Class BaseActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
        • BaseActor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Cullable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Blast, Bomb, Bomber, Bullet, Clouds, Coin, Door, Fire, Flag, Flames, Flyer, Ghost, Gun, Hero, Key, MainDoor, Solid, Springboard, Waterdrops
    public class BaseActor
extends com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
    Extends functionality of the LibGDX Actor class. by adding support for textures/animation, collision polygons, movement, world boundaries, and camera scrolling. Most game objects should extend this class; lists of extensions can be retrieved by stage and class name.
    Author:
    Lee Stemkoski
    See Also:
    #Actor

        Parameters:
        fileNames - array of names of files containing animation images
        frameDuration - how long each frame should be displayed
        loop - should the animation loop

        rows - number of rows of images in spritesheet
        cols - number of columns of images in spritesheet
        frameDuration - how long each frame should be displayed
        loop - should the animation loop
        Returns:
        animation created (useful for storing multiple animations)

      • setOpacity

        Sets the opacity of this actor.
        Parameters:
        opacity - value from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque)

      • setAcceleration

        public void setAcceleration​(float acc)
        Set acceleration of this object.
        Parameters:
        acc - Acceleration in (pixels/second) per second.

      • setDeceleration

        public void setDeceleration​(float dec)
        Set deceleration of this object. Deceleration is only applied when object is not accelerating.
        Parameters:
        dec - Deceleration in (pixels/second) per second.

      • setMaxSpeed

        public void setMaxSpeed​(float ms)
        Set maximum speed of this object.
        Parameters:
        ms - Maximum speed of this object in (pixels/second).

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed​(float speed)
        Set the speed of movement (in pixels/second) in current direction. If current speed is zero (direction is undefined), direction will be set to 0 degrees.
        Parameters:
        speed - of movement (pixels/second)

      • getSpeed

        public float getSpeed()
        Calculates the speed of movement (in pixels/second).
        Returns:
        speed of movement (pixels/second)

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Determines if this object is moving (if speed is greater than zero).
        Returns:
        false when speed is zero, true otherwise

      • setMotionAngle

        public void setMotionAngle​(float angle)
        Sets the angle of motion (in degrees). If current speed is zero, this will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        angle - of motion (degrees)

      • getMotionAngle

        public float getMotionAngle()
        Get the angle of motion (in degrees), calculated from the velocity vector.
        To align actor image angle with motion angle, use setRotation( getMotionAngle() ).
        Returns:
        angle of motion (degrees)

      • accelerateAtAngle

        public void accelerateAtAngle​(float angle)
        Update accelerate vector by angle and value stored in acceleration field. Acceleration is applied by applyPhysics method.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle (degrees) in which to accelerate.
        See Also:
        acceleration, applyPhysics(float)

      • accelerateForward

        public void accelerateForward()
        Update accelerate vector by current rotation angle and value stored in acceleration field. Acceleration is applied by applyPhysics method.
        See Also:
        acceleration, applyPhysics(float)

      • applyPhysics

        public void applyPhysics​(float dt)
        Adjust velocity vector based on acceleration vector, then adjust position based on velocity vector.
        If not accelerating, deceleration value is applied.
        Speed is limited by maxSpeed value.
        Acceleration vector reset to (0,0) at end of method.
        Parameters:
        dt - Time elapsed since previous frame (delta time); typically obtained from act method.
        See Also:
        acceleration, deceleration, maxSpeed

      • setBoundaryRectangle

        public void setBoundaryRectangle()
        Set rectangular-shaped collision polygon. This method is automatically called when animation is set, provided that the current boundary polygon is null.
        See Also:
        setAnimation(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Animation<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion>)

      • setBoundaryPolygon

        public void setBoundaryPolygon​(int numSides)
        Replace default (rectangle) collision polygon with an n-sided polygon.
        Vertices of polygon lie on the ellipse contained within bounding rectangle. Note: one vertex will be located at point (0,width); a 4-sided polygon will appear in the orientation of a diamond.
        Parameters:
        numSides - number of sides of the collision polygon

      • getBoundaryPolygon

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Polygon getBoundaryPolygon()
        Returns bounding polygon for this BaseActor, adjusted by Actor's current position and rotation.
        Returns:
        bounding polygon for this BaseActor

      • overlaps

        public boolean overlaps​(BaseActor other)
        Determine if this BaseActor overlaps other BaseActor (according to collision polygons).
        Parameters:
        other - BaseActor to check for overlap
        Returns:
        true if collision polygons of this and other BaseActor overlap
        See Also:
        setBoundaryRectangle(), setBoundaryPolygon(int)

      • preventOverlap

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 preventOverlap​(BaseActor other)
        Implement a "solid"-like behavior: when there is overlap, move this BaseActor away from other BaseActor along minimum translation vector until there is no overlap.
        Parameters:
        other - BaseActor to check for overlap
        Returns:
        direction vector by which actor was translated, null if no overlap

      • isWithinDistance

        public boolean isWithinDistance​(float distance,
                                BaseActor other)
        Determine if this BaseActor is near other BaseActor (according to collision polygons).
        Parameters:
        distance - amount (pixels) by which to enlarge collision polygon width and height
        other - BaseActor to check if nearby
        Returns:
        true if collision polygons of this (enlarged) and other BaseActor overlap
        See Also:
        setBoundaryRectangle(), setBoundaryPolygon(int)

      • setWorldBounds

        public static void setWorldBounds​(float width,
                                  float height)
        Set world dimensions for use by methods boundToWorld() and alignCamera().
        Parameters:
        width - width of world
        height - height of world

      • setWorldBounds

        public static void setWorldBounds​(BaseActor ba)
        Set world dimensions for use by methods boundToWorld() and scrollTo().
        Parameters:
        BaseActor - whose size determines the world bounds (typically a background image)

      • getWorldBounds

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle getWorldBounds()
        Get world dimensions
        Returns:
        Rectangle whose width/height represent world bounds

      • boundToWorld

        public void boundToWorld()
        If an edge of an object moves past the world bounds, adjust its position to keep it completely on screen.

      • alignCamera

        public void alignCamera()
        Center camera on this object, while keeping camera's range of view (determined by screen size) completely within world bounds.

      • getList

        public static ArrayList<BaseActor> getList​(com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage stage,
                                           String className)
        Retrieves a list of all instances of the object from the given stage with the given class name or whose class extends the class with the given name. If no instances exist, returns an empty list. Useful when coding interactions between different types of game objects in update method.
        Parameters:
        stage - Stage containing BaseActor instances
        className - name of a class that extends the BaseActor class
        Returns:
        list of instances of the object in stage which extend with the given class name

      • count

        public static int count​(com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage stage,
                        String className)
        Returns number of instances of a given class (that extends BaseActor).
        Parameters:
        className - name of a class that extends the BaseActor class
        Returns:
        number of instances of the class

      • act

        public void act​(float dt)
        Processes all Actions and related code for this object; automatically called by act method in Stage class.
        Overrides:
        act in class com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
        Parameters:
        dt - elapsed time (second) since last frame (supplied by Stage act method)

      • draw

        public void draw​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch,
                 float parentAlpha)
        Draws current frame of animation; automatically called by draw method in Stage class.
        If color has been set, image will be tinted by that color.
        If no animation has been set or object is invisible, nothing will be drawn.
        Overrides:
        draw in class com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
        Parameters:
        batch - (supplied by Stage draw method)
        parentAlpha - (supplied by Stage draw method)
        See Also:
        Actor.setColor(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color), Actor.setVisible(boolean)
